snippet: Consumer spending, which increased 5.2 percent in March, is crucial to reigniting growth after two decades of stagnation.
abstract: Ministry of Internal Affairs and Communications reports that Japan's household spending surged 5.2 percent in March, fastest pace in nine years and a sign that Prime Minister Shinzo Abe's effort to end two decades of stagnation and lift consumer confidence is setting the stage for an economic revival.
lead_paragraph: Consumer spending, which increased 5.2 percent in March, is crucial to reigniting growth after two decades of stagnation.

headline.seo: Household Spending in Japan Soars at Fastest Pace in 9 Years.
headline.main: Household Spending Soars in Japan, Fastest in 9 Years
headline.print_headline: Household Spending Soars In Japan, Fastest in 9 Years
